lead_paragraph: The Virginia Whig State Convention met here to-day,andthe attendance was very large. Col. Boardurant was chosen President. Mr. Segur nominated George W. Summers, of Kanawha, for Governor, which was carried by acclamation, and Mr. Sheffey stated that Mr. Summers would accept the nomination. Speeches were delivered by a number of distinguished gentlemen, and the Convention was very harmonious and enthusiastic.
